  physical_appearance: This is a copper plate that has been cut out in the silhouette of a Jina. Standing straight with arms by his side
 long prominent ears
 the sculpture ends with a finial at the top.

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: The Siddhapratima Yantra
 meaning magical diagram depicting a perfected being
 shows the silhouette of a Jina from the Digambara sect of Jainism. It is cut out of a copper plaque which is stele-shaped with a stepped base
 the usual style of a sculpture
 except there is a space where the figure would be. This type of image is a way of showing a formless form. It denotes the ultimate transcendence of the perfected being.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a copper plate that has been cut out in the silhouette of a Jina. Standing straight with arms by his side, long prominent ears, the sculpture ends with a finial at the top.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Sunyata Jainism Religious articles Figurative art Copperwork
metadata.subject_terms_3: Indian sculpture/ sculpture? Religion and Philosophy
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The Siddhapratima Yantra, meaning magical diagram depicting a perfected being, shows the silhouette of a Jina from the Digambara sect of Jainism. It is cut out of a copper plaque which is stele-shaped with a stepped base, the usual style of a sculpture, except there is a space where the figure would be. This type of image is a way of showing a formless form. It denotes the ultimate transcendence of the perfected being.
